sourceMeaningMnemonic: You put a grain in your mouth and let it take a ride. This kanji has the same radicals as 和, but this time the grain is in your mouth, which is why there's little pieces of grain sticking out of the 口 part ;)
meaningInfo: Just imagine you're a car or a train and the grain is a person. It's going for a nice ride in your mouth!
readingMnemonic: You decide the grain is probably lonely on this <kanji>ride</kanji> alone, so you add some <reading>no</reading>ri (<ja>の</ja>) seaweed, so it has a friend.
readingInfo: Now the nori is going for a ride too, woohoo!
